de.javasoft.swing
Class SystemMonitor

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  de.javasoft.swing.SystemMonitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
ModelChangedListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class SystemMonitor
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements ModelChangedListener

A SystemMonitor can be used for graphically displaying the progress of values. A graph represents a collector which is responsible for retrieving values. Multiple collectors/graphs can be added to a single monitor. A monitor creates one repaint thread which is resposible for refreshing the display. Additional threads will be started by the model as soon as a new collector is added. The repaint thread is independent from the collection threads. Generally you don't have to take care about starting and stopping threads. The complete thread handling will be done under the hood. You can control thread stopping by creating monitors through calling the constructor with an autoStop argument (SystemMonitor(false)).
The CollectorFactory contains some predefined collectors for CPU-Usage, Heap-Usage, OS-Memory-Usage and more.

Version:
1.04, 01.10.2009
See Also:
Serialized Form

SystemMonitor

public SystemMonitor(boolean autoStop)
Constructor.

Parameters:
autoStop - True - the monitor stops all used threads if the component will be removed from ancestor. In case you're sharing one model with multiple monitors it is recommended to create additional monitors with autostop = false.

addCollector

public void addCollector(java.lang.String id,
                         Collector collector)
Adds a collector to the monitor. The last added collector will be displayed topmost. A collector is responsible for gathering data. The collector methods will be called isochronus, specified by the delay param. For every added collector a new thread will be started. Generally you don't have to take care about stopping these threads because they will be stopped automatically if the component isn't referenced any longer by another component.
The default bufferSize is 400. The default delay is 500ms.

Parameters:
id - Unique collector id.
collector - The collector used for gathering values.
See Also:
addCollector(String, int, Collector), stop()

addCollector

public void addCollector(java.lang.String id,
                         int delay,
                         Collector collector)
Adds a collector to the monitor. A collector is responsible for gathering data. The collector methods will be called isochronus, specified by the delay param. For every added collector a new thread will be started. Generally you don't have to take care about stopping these threads because they will be stopped automatically if the component isn't referenced any longer by another component.
The used default bufferSize is 400.

Parameters:
id - Unique collector id.
delay - Delay between collector calls in milliseconds.
collector - The collector used for gathering values.
See Also:
addCollector(String, int, int, Collector), stop()

addCollector

public void addCollector(java.lang.String id,
                         int bufferSize,
                         int delay,
                         Collector collector)
Adds a collector to the monitor. A collector is responsible for gathering data. The collector methods will be called isochronus, specified by the delay param. For every added collector a new thread will be started. Generally you don't have to take care about stopping these threads because they will be stopped automatically if the component isn't referenced any longer by another component.

Parameters:
id - Unique collector id.
bufferSize - Number of values to be buffered.
delay - Delay between collector calls in milliseconds.
collector - The collector used for gathering values.
See Also:
SystemMonitorModel.addCollector(String, int, int, Collector), stop()

stop

public void stop()
Stop all threads (including repaint thread) used by this monitor. Generally you don't have to take care about stopping threads because they will be stopped automatically if the component isn't referenced any longer by another component. In case you have to stop threads manually please use the appropriate monitor construtor - SystemMonitor(boolean autoStop).

See Also:
stopRepaintThread(), SystemMonitorModel.removeAll()

stopRepaintThread

public void stopRepaintThread()
Stop the repaint thread.

See Also:
stop()

initPopupMenu

protected void initPopupMenu(javax.swing.JPopupMenu popupMenu)
Initialize context popupMenu. Adds all menuEntries to the specified popupMenu. The popupMenu is the user interface to enable/disable graphs.

Parameters:
popupMenu - The popupMenu to which items will be added.

getCaptionPanel

Returns:
South panel of SystemMonitor.

addCaption

public void addCaption(java.lang.String id,
                       java.lang.String caption,
                       java.lang.String format,
                       boolean popupOnly)
Add a caption to SystemMonitors captionPanel. Captions will be displayed in the same order as added to the monitor. Please see java.util.Formatter for more informations on how to use format. Instead of %$1, %$2, %$3 the format string supports %{value}, %{maxValue} and %{percentValue}. If a collector is set to invisible the caption will be invisible too.
Example:
monitor.addCaption(CollectorFactory.CollectorID.HEAP_MEMORY_USAGE.id, "Heap Usage:", "%{value},.2fMB / %{maxValue},.2fMB / %{percentValue}.0f%%", false);

Parameters:
id - Collector ID to which the caption belongs.
caption - Caption used as description label.
format - Format string for caption values.
popupOnly - True - display caption only within popupMonitor.
See Also:
Formatter, getCaptionPanel(), getValueLabels(), setVisible(String, boolean)

setRefreshTime

public void setRefreshTime(int time)
Set the delay for repainting component to refresh graphs and values. The default refreshTime is 1000ms.

Parameters:
time - The delay used for repainting component in milliseconds.
See Also:
getRefreshTime()

getRefreshTime

public int getRefreshTime()
Getter for refresh time.

Returns:
The refresh time in milliseconds.
See Also:
setRefreshTime(int)

setModel

public void setModel(SystemMonitorModel model)
Sets the model for the component. If you decide to share a model by multiple monitors the additional monitors should be created with autoStop = false to avoid stopping all collector threads when the component is removed from the parent container. In this case you have to stop the repaint thread manually through #stopRepaintThread().

Parameters:
model - The model to be used by this component.
See Also:
getModel(), stopRepaintThread()

The used model.
See Also:
setModel(SystemMonitorModel)

getValueLabels

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,javax.swing.JLabel> getValueLabels()
Returns a map with all used value labels. The collector IDs are used as map keys. Each label contains the clients properties listed below: "id" - the collector id "caption" - the caption text "format" - the format string "popupOnly" - display only on popupMonitor "captionLabel" - the appropriate caption label for this value label

Returns:
Map of used value labels.
See Also:
addCaption(String, String, String, boolean)
